@KPdoubleyou @irishglycogirl @shasqipharma @UCSDChemBiochem @UDelaware I think of this as a first in class example of bioorthogonal chemistry in humans.  Covalent chemistry has, of course, been performed in humans for decades in the form of numerous covalent drugs.  Agree that the use of "click" simply enhances cognitive resonance of the headlines.

@subsurface_life @UDelaware Universities have a hard time understanding what postdocs are even when there‚Äôs not a pandemic.

@GemmaReguera @BioPhysicalMoh @UDelaware Sadly our admin has spent its time seemingly trying to pit unionized faculty vs staff. 

Then they cut staff pay the night before a union meeting, which they knew was happening. Oh it's been fun.
@GemmaReguera @BioPhysicalMoh @subsurface_life @UDelaware For me, with very little savings and no job...but an NIH fellowship that paid my tuition, it was scary.

@subsurface_life @BioPhysicalMoh @UDelaware You are lucky to have a union. Only fixed-term faculty have one here. The university did not even negotiate with them so they were not included in the salary reductions.

@GemmaReguera @BioPhysicalMoh @subsurface_life @UDelaware When I was in grad school a million years ago, it was suddenly decided that we were supposed to pay taxes on the value of tuition (at Stanford, that was not a small amount). It took a lot of outrage to reverse that silliness. I do NOT understand bureaucracy.
@subsurface_life @UDelaware Oh I know...it's crazy to punish grant funded staff. I fear that is coming here again soon :(
@BioPhysicalMoh @subsurface_life @UDelaware We also had to negotiate the salary cuts to faculty and administrators to make sure the % reduction was proportional to the salary base.
@BioPhysicalMoh @GemmaReguera @UDelaware hahahahaha, oh wait, you think we have a functional administration ;)
@SeepExplorer @UDelaware But fellows aren't impacted, just researchers. So, umm, that's not fair.
RT @subsurface_life: @UDelaware is forcing my Postdocs to take a pay cut along with staff when I HAVE THEIR SALARIES PAID FOR and not givin‚Ä¶

@subsurface_life @UDelaware The USG implemented a similar requirement during the 2008-2009 recession -- grant-funded staff - except graduate students because their salary was below the cut off - had go on furlough, just like state funded staff. There was a lot of push back but "fairness" üôÑ was the excuse

@subsurface_life @GemmaReguera @UDelaware I mean I can see how some confused office disconnected from research & academic operations might come up with this. But then the academic deans & provost didn't fix it??
@MikeTFox5 @ErinFox5DC @AnneArundelCC @UDelaware The growth of club lacrosse basically is the reason why. Double-edged sword.

@sunitachandra29 @OpenMP_ARB @NVIDIAHPCDev @NERSC @OLCFGOV @jhdavis_josh @thom_huber @CRPL_HPC @UDelaware @ORNL You can try to improve the performance of the reductions in clang/llvm using option -fopenmp-cuda-teams-reduction-recs-num=<num>. The default value is 1024, recommended to set it to the number of iterations in the loop.
@GemmaReguera @UDelaware We've been complaining, maybe I need to organize our efforts better.

@ElectricBiome @UDelaware It makes no sense. My grant money isn't part of the "university budget" and NOT paying someone actually decreases the F&A the university gets.
